node.title: 1/6 Committee Unanimously Votes to Recommend Ex-DOJ Official Jeffrey Clark for Contempt
node.alt: The January 6 Committee has voted to recommend contempt charges against former DOJ lawyer Jeffrey Clark. Here, the committee can be seen meeting during a previous hearing.
node.description: Clark becomes the second former Trump ally to be referred for criminal contempt.
node.content:
["The House Select Committee on the January 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol unanimously voted Wednesday to recommend contempt of Congress charges for former DOJ lawyer Jeffrey Clark.", "The committee voted 9-0 to recommend the charges against Clark, who was one of the attorneys instrumental in former President Donald Trump's unsuccessful bid to overturn the 2020 presidential election.", "Clark becomes the second former Trump ally, following former chief strategist Steve Bannon, to be recommended for contempt charges.", "\"As legislators charged with finding truth about an attack on our democracy and sworn to support and defend the Constitution\u2014we put Mr. Clark on our witness list...he refused to cooperate...Mr. Clark has left us no other choice,\" said Committee Chair Bennie Thompson.", "Thompson added that Clark is expected to plead the fifth and invoke his right against self-incrimination, according to his lawyers.", "This is a breaking news story and will be updated with additional information.", "", "
The January 6 Committee has voted to recommend contempt charges against former DOJ lawyer Jeffrey Clark. Here, the committee can be seen meeting during a previous hearing.
"]
